snippet: Twenty-nine years before Yaroslava Shvedova achieved a Golden Set, Bill Scanlon set the bar for perfection in the Open Era.
abstract: Yaroslava Shvedova achieves a Golden Set--winning all 24 points--at the start of her third-round Wimbledon victory over Sara Errani, something that no woman has done since the start of the Open era in 1968; Bill Scanlon in 1983 is the only other player to do so in professional tennis.
lead_paragraph: Twenty-nine years before Yaroslava Shvedova achieved a Golden Set, Bill Scanlon set the bar for perfection in the Open Era.

headline.seo: Yaroslava Shvedova Joins Bill Scanlon as Only 2 to Tally Golden Set in Open Era
headline.main: Scanlon Says His Feat Gains by Being Matched
headline.print_headline: Scanlon Says His Feat Gains by Being Matched
